title: Proposal for Example Programs That Illustrate Python APIs
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
N/A

**Describe the use case**
### Proposal
Create example programs that demonstrate Ludwig's Python apis.  Example programs will mirror subset of [Ludwig's command line examples](https://uber.github.io/ludwig/examples/).  This proposal covers Python programs for 
* Titanic Survivor
* MNIST
* Text Classification

Sample programs will perform perform one or more of the following functions:
* Training
* Predictions
* Visualizations
* Accessing and analyzing Ludwig's results files (e.g., training_statistics.json)

[This](https://github.com/jimthompson5802/ludwig_examples/tree/master/mnist) illustrates the proposal.

If desired, example programs can be provided in both native python programs (*.py) and Jupyter notebooks (*.ipynb) formats.

A new sub-directory called `examples` will be created in the project's root directory.  Structure of the `examples` of this new directory follows:
``` 
    examples/
        titanic/
            model_training.py
            model_training.ipynb
            model_definition.yaml
            . . .
        mnist/
            . . .
        text/
            . . .
```

 ### Considerations
 * If major changes are expected in the apis, then creating example programs 
 at this time may be premature. 
 * If significant changes are planned to the structure or format of the results files, then example programs demonstrating access may not make sense.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Sample programs and instructions for running the programs.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
N/A

**Additional context**
I'm willing to work on this if the proposal makes sense.
